Description: Fragment from lower part of body of North Ionian pottery oinochoe; white slip; inside reserved. Exterior: grazing goat striding right, added red on body; filling ornament of four-part closed rosette, dot rosette with concentric circles, cross with dotted squares, and perhaps spiky rosette (?); bands with added red and white bands above and below. Below, slight part of lower frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by British School at Athens. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Smith 2009 mistakenly attributes the sherd to the South Ionian Middle Wild Goat II Style. See krater fragments from Lindos with similar goat, composition and filling ornament: Blinkenberg 1931 no.988 and pl.46. T.J. Smith, East Greek Pottery in the Collection of the British School at Athens", BSA 104, 2009, 346-347, fig. 1.
The number '2' is written in ink on the interior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Smith 2009 / East Greek Pottery in the Collection of the British School at Athens (pp. 346-7, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.661)
